topic.title: Fuck economic growth
topic.body: The filthy rich get even more rich, the horribly poor stay horribly poor, and the middle class is ceasing to exist. With all of that, the climate is getting destroyed and in 20-30 years we will murder each other for a glass of water. What the fuck must happen for governments and corporations to realize that when they trade in everything for money, they will find out that money cannot be eaten or breathed?

topic.title: Suicide method
topic.body: What's the best one that is accessible, quick and painless? Gun would be best, but I live in Europe where gun ownership is extremely restricted. And I tried hanging, but it just won't work on a stupid small hook on the wall.

topic.title: Zite data backup strategy???
topic.body:
Despite being only about 500 MB in size, my zite data has about 70,000 files in it, making incremental hardlink-based backup with rsync extremely slow, and even removing such backup with rm -rf is also slow as hell. Creating archive is slow too. I currently have a script to just copy everything to external drive every time, because just copying is much faster than incremental rsync. But this doesn't solve rm -rf'ing old backups.

I mean, come on: incremental hardlink-based backup of ALL my data sans zeronet is many times faster than simply backing up zeronet. Fuck this shit.

1573291463_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2.body: Don't use any binary blobs on your daily Linux setup, just don't. Buy a console or a separate Windows PC and use it ONLY for gaming.

> [randomshits](#comment_258_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): Why not dual boot your system? You can even dual boot from two HDDs. [...]

Yeah, this works too. Just make sure you have separate bootloaders on separate physical drives. This way OSes will be 100% independent from each other, and also Windows is known to fuck up another OS installed on the same physical drive.

And make sure to encrypt your Linux installation so that Windows can't see into it.

1573477450_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2.body: ZeroNet works with Tor Browser with linux, you only have to uncomment two lines in tor's config file. It's all in the docs. Separate browser would be overkill and a hazard to privacy (since Tor Browser depends on many people with the same fingerprint using it, so if a new browser is made, we will stand out a lot)

> [filips](#comment_308_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): @h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm Can you explain how this specific features harm privacy: [...]

URL autofill can be very harmful to privacy if you use it for search engine suggestions, because it sends every letter you type to Google/DDG/whatever even if you just wanted to enter a URL directly and not search for anything.

As for the other things, they probably don't harm privacy but introduce too much bloat for the software, making it slower and more prone to undiscovered 0-days. The more the code, the more chance there is something to be exploited in it.

Although I especially hate that Mozilla integrated Pocket into Firefox. It's total nonsense (you can just use Firefox Sync), it wants you to pay for premium, and its privacy is dubious at best. Fortunately, you can easily disable it with one config change (extensions.pocket.enabled = false). I also don't get why Google is still the default search engine for Firefox - maybe not to scare normies migrating from chrome?

1573531510_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: If google bans you for any reason, you lose yours emails, calendar, photos, drive files, youtube playlists, tasks and even ability to use your android phone. Even if you use E2E cloud, never rely on it, you don't own cloud data.

1573734530_17Tr1vdXC29zwecUt2pyPNMcHsqpJ.body: Because zeronet is built on BitTorrent protocol, which is not anonymous and private. You need extra measures like Tor (better) or VPN (worse) to really hide your IP and traffic from ISP

> [rex4539@kxoid.bit](#comment_3_18F1Ga3hcY5ZSPoD5jeFow6w7uHyRtocdf): You do not NEED to use tor but using it gives you greater anonymity, if that's what you're looking for. And using Tor Browser enhances that anonymity even further. Any other browser can be fingerprinted and leak metadata.

Is it actually possible for anyone to fingerprint and track you when using Zites if you for example change your default window size? Of course, the greatest benefit is that if zite makes a connection to clearnet, or you click a link to clearnet, Tor Browser will protect you from being compromised.

1573764857_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: They don't understand Tor is not only about changing your IP address. They don't know about fingerprinting, which Tor Browser is the only thing that currently reasonably protects from. They think just by changing their IP, they are untrackable.
omg stop picking out each other's faults and just shut up if you have nothing valuable to say.

1573773567_14WtAM4JZ6xzfVV3b31VNu2a3YoUn.body:
> [1bfqutudhtexlka](#comment_37_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2EhuAY): then what is the difference from normal net ?isn't that "censoring" with extra steps ?

I believe ZeroNet is made with resistance to censorship on a different layer. Government can't censor or force a zite to shut down, but a zite CAN censor users' content on zite, provided it's done by someone who has admin rights on it.

1573794798_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [goodafternoon](#comment_26_1BL1pFELvZ58apCLcxogy2W66aC4vKLfY3): I did some quick research on Lokinet. my conclusion, whats wrong with Zeronet? There is a community here already and seeding is free range and not forced with coin. I would check out apps but I think it wont be long before they are drug over here.

Because we need diversity. If there was only one VPN provider for example, it would eventually corrupt and we would have nowhere else to run. Take a look also at Startpage.com - it was a really good search engine that has recently been sold to an ad company. If there were no other private search engines like DDG, searx or ecosia, we would be utterly fucked. If Ubuntu was the only Linux there is, we would be at mercy of Canonical corporation and their Amazon spyware bullshit when it was active, with nothing else to turn to. But fortunately, there is Debian, Arch, SUSE, and even BSD to choose from. Don't like GNOME and systemd monopoly? Use Devuan which comes with Xfce and sysvinit by default. Don't like Mozilla's shady practices? Use Tor browser, Waterfox or Palemoon. Do you not really trust Protonmail team? Use Tutanota, Posteo, Disroot, or even GPG encryption with any provider. Or even use different providers at the same time for different things, with no single point of failure. Simple as that.

What if zeronet dev goes state's?
